intro: Allium aksekiense, commonly known as the Akseki garlic, is a rare bulbous plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, fleshy bulbs and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale pink to white flowers with six petals, typical of the Allium genus. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native habitat.
